election_record.label: Vermont 1818 Lieutenant Governor

overview.note: The Original Election Returns aggregate tally sheet lists 14609 total votes for Paul Brigham; however, the sum of totals per county is 14619.
The Original Election Returns aggregate tally sheet lists 799 votes for candidates other than Paul Brigham; however, the sum of these votes taken from tally sheets for the individual counties is 821.

The Vermont Gazette (Bennington, VT), October 13, The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT), October 16, The Vermont Republican and American Yeoman (Windsor, VT), October 19, The Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT), October 19, The Vermont Journal (Windsor, VT), October 19, The Rutland Vermont Herald (Rutland, VT), October 20 and The Christian Messenger (Middlebury, VT), October 21, report 14609 votes for Paul Brigham.

The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT), October 16, The Vermont Republican and American Yeoman (Windsor, VT), October 19, The Vermont Journal (Windsor, VT), October 19, The Rutland Vermont Herald (Rutland, VT), October 20 and The Christian Messenger (Middlebury, VT), October 21, report 563 scattering votes.
The Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT), October 19, reports 663 scattering votes.
The Vermont Gazette (Bennington, VT), October 13, reports 236 votes for Moses Robinson.

"PRINTED VOTES. On canvassing the votes for Gov. etc. the present session, it was found that a considerable number of the votes were printed. A question arose before the canvassing committee, whether by the constitution they could be counted--considerable debate arose--but on examining the constitution, it was decided by a large majority, to reject the printed votes." Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT). October 16, 1818.

sub_unit.name: Addison
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet lists 857 votes for Paul Brigham and no scattering votes in Addison County; however, the sum of totals per town is 957 votes for Brigham and 20 scattering votes.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns aggregate tally sheet lists 218 scattering votes in Franklin County; however, the sum of totals per town is 208 scattering votes.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: In 1818, the town of Huntsburgh was renamed Franklin.

sub_unit.name: Orleans
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns aggregate tally sheet lists 34 scattering votes in Orleans County; however, the sum of totals per town is 35 scattering votes.

sub_unit.name: Rutland
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns aggregate tally sheet lists 54 scattering votes in Rutland County; however, the sum of totals per town is 55 scattering votes.

sub_unit.name: Fairhaven
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet has a note that votes from Fairhaven were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Ira
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet has a note that votes from Ira were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Windsor
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns aggregate tally sheet lists 2693 votes for Paul Brigham and 24 scattering votes in Franklin County; however, the sum of totals per town is 2663 votes for Brigham and 34 scattering votes.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. Vermont State Archives, Middlesex.
Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT). October 19, 1818.
Vermont Republican and American Yeoman (Windsor, VT). October 19, 1818.
